paragraphs.paragraph: Greetings, my name is Mack. I am a \b{computer science student} at Auburn University. Lately I've been studying \b{deep learning} with intent to develop a \b{market analysis tool}. I am excited to enter the labor force of business engineering when I graduate in 2027. I have broad experience in \b{software, research, and entreprenuership} which portray my passion for learning. I am always looking for a new project to work on, so don't hesitate to reach out.
send me reels mackthompson16@gmail.com
Python, Java, C#, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, SQL, Ruby, MIPS Assembly
React, Next.js, Node.js, Tailwind, CSS, Pandas, NumPy, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Selenium, OpenAI, SDK, NUnit, WinAppDriver
Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Firebase, Shopify (Liquid), Git/GitHub, AZDO, Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe Photoshop, Autodesk Fusion 360, WebSockets, GraphQL, Excel, Wix

list: The \b{intelligence revolution} will define my generation
If I can understand the complexity of a computer, some day \b{I might} understand myself.

paragraphs.paragraph: My Business Engineering Technology (BET) minor forces me to collaborate on \b{entreprenuial projects} with students \b{across disciplines}.
I study mathematics to deepen my understanding of \b{machine learning, big data, and philosophy!} I am on track to \b{double major} but have not commited yet.
Each year I travel with Auburn's team to compete in \b{ICPC}. We have meetings weekly and mock competitions monthly. I took home a \b{medal} in 2024!
My fraternity helps me socialize and let off steam. I try to have the new CSSE members come to ICPC with me.
Stars is a computing \b{outreach program} for K-12. I've made presentations for highschool classes and run tables at college day.

Last summer I had the privilige to work for a groundbreaking \b{platform software} company that builds novel solutions for construction projects. I worked primarily for the \b{quality assurance team}.
list: Wrote \b{internal functions} to broaden the testing framework.
Created a developer tool that \b{increased my teamâ€™s efficiency by ~30%.}

paragraphs.paragraph: I'm building solutions for graduate students pursuing their dissertations.
For my most recent project I used vision to detect skin conditions. I \b{webscraped} and cleaned a dataset, then \b{diluted a public model} (EffcientNet) to measure the accuracy of medical diagnoses.
I also developed a therapy mobile app to experiment with \b{generative AI} in the realm of human psychology (full stack development).
I created a website for a local company, JupJewels, with lots of custom features, communicating \b{directly with the client}:
I founded this company in highschool. During our peak, we took around \b{55 kids} for \b{four weeklong sessions}. The estimated \b{profit} over 4 years was over \b{$100,000}.
I learned a lot:

paragraphs.paragraph: I created a calendar-sharing and messaging platform to understand how \b{data} is transferred and managed. This involved a small \b{API library}, a \b{server} for live messaging, and a \b{react app}.

I had a \b{traumatic head injury} (from a charity boxing match) that humilated my \b{pretentious invincibility complex}. This led me to write profusely about \b{life, death, purpose...} a conversation I needed to have with myself. I hope to publish my book by the time I graduate college, but it doesn't matter if no one reads it. \b{It matters to me.}
